channel.title: Science
channel.description: Science news from The New York Times. Get the latest developments about space, the environment, animal behavior, the brain, genetics, archeology and robots along with the weekly Science Times.

item.title: Elon Musk Says SpaceX Rocket Launches Might Resume Next Month
item.description: The chief executive of SpaceX outlined some details of what caused a rocket explosion in September.
item.author: By KENNETH CHANG

item.title: How Is Your Family Coping With Delhi’s Air Pollution?
item.description: The Times would like to hear from parents whose children are staying home from school to avoid exposure to dangerous levels of air pollution.
item.author: By THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: If a ‘Big Whack’ Made the Moon, Did it Also Knock the Earth on Its Side?
item.description: A new study suggests that it did. It also explains that the collision can explain the formation of the moon without a second event.
item.author: By KENNETH CHANG

item.title: Delhi Closes Over 1,800 Schools in Response to Dangerous Smog
item.description: The closings, part of an effort to shield children in India’s capital from air pollution, affect more than a million students.
item.author: By SUHASINI RAJ and ELLEN BARRY

item.title: A Slow Ride Toward the Future of Public Transportation
item.description: A self-driving bus being tested in Finland holds promise for reducing cities’ dependence on cars.
item.author: By HENRY FOUNTAIN

item.title: Whales Can Really Rock With Their Mellow Songs
item.description: A new study suggests that the vibrations from humpback whales have been overlooked and misunderstood. Underwater, they travel a long way.
item.author: By NICHOLAS ST. FLEUR

item.title: Young Adolescents as Likely to Die From Suicide as From Traffic Accidents
item.description: There are concerns that the pervasiveness and pressures of social media are contributing factors to a rising suicide rate for children ages 10 to 14.
item.author: By SABRINA TAVERNISE

item.title: When It Comes to Success, Age Really Is Just a Number
item.description: A new study points to a combination of personality, persistence and luck as leading to success, and scientists say that those same forces are at play at all levels of a discipline.
item.author: By BENEDICT CAREY

item.title: What Lady Gaga’s ‘Bad Romance’ and Other Earworm Songs Have in Common
item.description: In the largest ever study of songs that play on repeat in your head, researchers found earworms had unusual intervals along with fast melodies.
item.author: By JOANNA KLEIN

item.title: Ebola Evolved Into Deadlier Enemy During the African Epidemic
item.description: A mutated version of the virus was more effective at entering human cells, scientists report. The finding may help explain the vast scope of the last outbreak.
item.author: By CARL ZIMMER
